      • setBackground

        public void setBackground(IDrawable element)
        Description copied from interface: IView
        Call this method to identify a drawable to use as the background image. This should not be a drawable that is used as an argument to "draw"
        Specified by:
        setBackground in interface IView
        Parameters:
        element - This is the element which will be identified as the background image.
        See Also:
        IView.setBackground(votebox.middle.view.IDrawable)

      • register

        public void register(EventType eventType,
            IEventHandler lambda)
        Description copied from interface: IView
        This method is the means that an outsider can use to register for an input event with the view. In our system, "registering for an event" involves asking a view to dispatch events of a certain abstract type to a queue that the requester provides.
        Specified by:
        register in interface IView
        Parameters:
        eventType - This is the abstract event type that is being registered on.
        lambda - Execute this handler when the event happens.
        See Also:
        IView.register(votebox.middle.view.EventType, votebox.middle.view.IEventHandler)

      • makeHitBox

        protected java.awt.Rectangle makeHitBox(IDrawable drawable)
        Call this method to create a rectangle that appropriately represents the hit box of a given drawable.
        Parameters:
        drawable - This is the given drawable.
        Returns:
        This method returns the rectangle that represents the hitbox of drawable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This method throws an exception if the drawable does not know its image and has a problem finding it.

      • getFocusableFromHitbox

        protected IDrawable getFocusableFromHitbox(int x,
                               int y)
        Get the focusable which covers a given (x,y) coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - This is the given x-coordinate.
        y - This is the given y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        This method returns the focusable which contains the given coordinate pair, or null if there is no focusable associated with the pair.

      • deliver

        protected void deliver(EventType type,
           InputEvent event)
        If a given event type has been registered for, execute its handler. Returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        type - If this type of event has been registered for, execute the handler.
        event - This structure wraps information about the event.
